___birthDate.description: The birth date of the document holder.

___EffectiveExpireDate.description: The effective and expiry date of the document.

___birthPlace.description: Specifies the birth place of the document holder (e.g., city, state, county, province), when designating a country of birth, use BirthCountry.

___docID.description: Unique number assigned by authorities to document.

___Privacy.description: Allows for control of the sharing of document data between parties.

___holderType.description: Provides the type of document holder.

___contactName.description: Provides contact name associated with the document.

___gender.description: The gender of the document holder.

___docIssueAuthority.description: Indicates the group or association that granted the document.

___remark.description: A remark associated with the document.

___DocType.description: Indicates the type of document (e.g. Passport, Military ID, Drivers License, national ID, Vaccination Certificate). Refer to OpenTravel Code List Document Type (DOC).

___docHolderNationality.description: The country code of the nationality of the document holder.

___docIssueStateProv.description: State or Province where the document was issued.

___postalCode.description: Defines the postal code (e.g., ZIP code) on the document.

___docIssueCountry.description: Country where the document was issued.

___birthCountry.description: Specifies the birth country of the document holder.

___docIssueLocation.description: Indicates the location where the document was issued.

___relation.description: Indicates the type of relationship with the person in the profile, such as Spouse, Child, Family, Business Associate, Interest Group, Medical, Security, Other, etc.

___Privacy.description: Allows for control of the sharing of related traveler data between parties.

___remark.description: A remark associated with the travel arranger.

___defaultInd.description: Indicates that the receiving system should assume the default value if the user specifies no overriding value or action.

___type.description: Type of service making travel plans or transactions (e.g., travel agency, etc.).

___Privacy.description: Allows for control of the sharing of travel arranger data between parties.

___CompanyName.description: Company name of the travel arranger.

___id.description: A unique reference for a travel arranger within this message.

___description.description: A description of the trip purpose.

___code.description: A code identifiying the purpose of the trip.

___Company.description: Company that defines the list of purpose codes.
Company that defines the list of purpose codes.

___Identifier.description:
Identifier provides the ability to create a globally unique identifier. For the identifier to be globally unique it must have a system provided identifier and the system must be identified using a global naming authority. System identification uses the domain naming system (DNS) to assure they are globally unique and should be an URL. The system provided ID will typically be a primary or surrogate key in a database.

The URL, system and company attributes can be omitted only when the system context can be implied by a parent or ancestor element.

___RequiredPayment.description: A deposit policy that is associated to this company.

___TravelArranger.description: Information on the organization responsible for arranging travel for the company.

___Trip_Purposes.description: Trip purpose codes used by this company.

___officeType.description: Designates the office category within an organization.

___department.description: The department name or ID with which the contact is associated.

___InternalReferenceNumber.description: Accounting code(s) assigned to travel for employer.

___division.description: The division name or ID with which the contact is associated.

___Privacy.description: Allows for control of the sharing of data between parties.

___Telephone.description: Information about a telephone number, including the actual number and its usage.

___maritalStatus_Enum.description: Specifies the marital status of the person.

___deceasedInd.description: When true the customer is deceased.

___vIP_Ind.description: If true, indicates a very important person.

___previouslyMarriedInd.description: When true, indicates the customer was previously married. When false, indicates the customer was not previously married.

___children.description: The number of children of the customer.

___customerValue.description: The supplier's ranking of the customer (e.g., VIP, numerical ranking).

Identifier provides the ability to create a globally unique identifier. Employment identification; using an employee ID number, title, level within the company, and an indication of their status (e.g., active, retired, on leave, or terminated from employment).  Additional information about an employee can be entered into the element, including the name of the employee, if it differs from the person name identified as a customer or contact.
